content: The "Helping Veterans Exposed to Burn Pits Act" establishes a Center of Excellence for health conditions related to exposure to burn pits and environmental exposures. The "Helping Veterans Exposed to Burn Pits Act" establishes a Center of Excellence within the Department of Veterans Affairs for the prevention, diagnosis, treatment, and rehabilitation of health conditions related to exposure to burn pits and environmental exposures. The Secretary will establish the center using existing department directives, recommendations from oversight bodies, and guidance from the Secretary of Defense. The Secretary will select a site for the Center of Excellence based on entities with specialized equipment, a track record of publishing information on post-deployment health exposures, access to relevant models, and expertise in allergy, immunology, and pulmonary diseases. The Center of Excellence will collaborate with various entities to address health conditions related to burn pits and environmental exposures. Its responsibilities include developing best practices, guiding health systems, and overseeing comprehensive measures. The Center of Excellence is tasked with training health professionals, facilitating research on the effects of burn pits and environmental exposures, disseminating best practices, conducting research on related health conditions, and providing medical treatment to veterans diagnosed with conditions from exposure. The Center of Excellence is responsible for utilizing data from the Burn Pits Registry to address medical conditions related to exposure to burn pits and other environmental hazards in Afghanistan and Iraq. The Helping Veterans Exposed to Burn Pits Act authorizes funding for research on hazardous materials and waste emissions in Afghanistan and Iraq. The Center of Excellence may receive additional funding for clinical and scientific investigations related to exposure to burn pits and environmental hazards. The Helping Veterans Exposed to Burn Pits Act establishes a Center of Excellence for prevention, diagnosis, treatment, and rehabilitation of health conditions related to exposure to burn pits and environmental hazards.
